name: Glacier Bay National Park and Preserve
Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park
Mendenhall Glacier
description: A rare chance to get up close and personal with a 13-mile ribbon of ice near downtown Juneau.

name: Brotherhood Bridge Trail
description: Every summer, the Mendenhall River greenbelt comes alive with an explosion of magenta flowers.

name: Upside Down Trees...
description: Upside-down trees serve as natural flower pots in this hanging garden of Alaska.

name: Treadwell Trail
description: The ruins of this Alaska gold mine form a gorgeous ghost town.

name: Sealaska Heritage Institute ARTS CAMPUS
description: Often mistaken for an office building, inside this venue is an amazing collection of Native Alaskan art.

name: Shrine of Saint Therese
description: This shrine to the patron saint of Alaska sits on a small tidal island and was built from the land’s own beach stones.

name: Point Bishop-Dupont Trailhead
description: The crumbling remains of Juneau's explosives storage site.

name: Last Chance Mining Museum
description: Impressive artifacts from Juneau's gold mining days fill this mining site-turned-museum.

name: Aunt Claudias Doll Museum
description: One toy collector's legacy of hundreds of unique items includes the most diverse display of northern indigenous dolls.

name: Petroglyph Beach State Historic Site
description: Low tide reveals 8,000-year-old rock carvings in Southern Alaska.

name: St. Michael the Archangel Orthodox Cathedral
description: The first Russian Orthodox church in North America and an Alaskan landmark.

name: Hammer Museum
description: A museum devoted entirely to hammers has more than 1,400 items on display dating back to the Romans.

name: White Pass & Yukon Route Railway
description: A historic freight system that found the true gold rush is in tourism.

name: Golden North Hotel
description: A classic gold rush hotel can be expected to pick up some ghosts along the way, and the Golden North is no exception.

name: Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park Visitor Center
Red Onion Saloon
description: Originally a brothel during the Klondike Gold Rush, this bar once used dolls to denote when ladies were working.

name: Arctic Brotherhood Hall
description: The facade of this relic from the Klondike gold rush is decorated with over 8,800 pieces of driftwood.
